articles.description: The 1st quarter moon happens on June 28, 2020, at 08:15 UTC. As viewed from anywhere on Earth, a 1st quarter moon is at its highest in the sky at sunset, looking like half a pie.
articles.content: View at EarthSky Community Photos. | Composite image of a moon nearly at 1st quarter with some of the features you can see on the moon at this phase – captured April 30, 2020 – by our friend Dr Ski i… [+2613 chars]

articles.title: All you need to know: June solstice 2020 - EarthSky
articles.description: The June solstice is June 20. Longest day for the Northern Hemisphere. Shortest day for the Southern Hemisphere. Details here.
articles.content:
The sunset has been making its way north, as illustrated in this 2016 photo composite by Abhijit Juvekar.
